name: Hotel Bijou

reviews.text: Fantastic Hotel. We arrived on the 19th September and stayed for a week. Great Central Location - 2 minutes walk from Cable Car, 5 minutes from Union Square. Rooms were fine for all the time we spent in them. Front Desk Staff were incredibly helpful and had no problems moving us to a room on a higher floor due to the street noise (although ear plugs were provided!!) and also arranged our Airport Transfer. They were always on hand to provide directions or recommendations for dinner etc. The complimentary breakfast of bagels and muffins was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Brilliant!!

reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant! Mr & Mrs White, UK

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. It is close to the BART, making it convienent to get to from the airport by public transportation, muni, bus and trolley lines. Its really easy to get around the city when you're so close to union square. There is a rental car area with all the big names right around the corner for a last minute day trip. Of course, there is lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Place to Stay!
Great little hotel
reviews.text: The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean. The location was very close to union square and market street but at night I did not feel safe going out due to the abudance of homeless people (not like the rest of san francisco). Overall a very nice little hotel.

reviews.title: Like a movie theatre only with a bed
reviews.text: The Bijou is a movie theme hotel that while small is fun and clean. The rooms are all named for film shot in and around San Francisco and the small theatre just off the lobby shows a San Francisco double feature every night.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: The deep rich colors in the lobby are carried through to the rooms where the colors are bright and rich. The beds are comfy and the closets large and stocked with an iron and ironing board extra pillows and an extra blanket.

reviews.title: What a plesant surprise
reviews.text: I had a room on the 6th floor with a queen bed, much larger than I had expected with a full bath. The one criticism I have of the bath tub was that due to the spigot being at one end and the drain control at the other it is not usable for soaking as you'd either be hitting your head or being poked in the back.

reviews.title: It Depends
reviews.text: Being a city dweller I am used to noise and wasn't kept awake by the busy streets on either side of the hotel. But in any event, the hotel provides ear plugs in the room. The neighborhood is grity but most of the street people are not dangerous and can be quite friendly when treated like human beings. If nothing else think of your interaction with them as an interesting cultural experince. Though the staff warns visitors of walking west from the hotel, the area is safe durning the day and as long as you are aware of your surroundings you can walk the streets at night.

reviews.title: A Surprising Gem
reviews.text: To be honest, I only booked a room at the Bijou because I was not able to make a last minute reservation at any of the hotels my company usually books. I was pleasantly surprised and happy with my experience.

The hotel has some of that character or charm usually found in older buildings that are well maintained. The 'motion picture' motif is clever and works fairly well (I stayed in 'The Bird Man of Alcatraz' on the 3rd floor). It was very clean and the staff was wonderful. From the lobby staff, to the maintentance man, to the lady cleaning the rooms, each individual I encountered was not just polite but genuinely warm and welcoming toward me as a person. I had no time for the 'free breakfast' and can not comment on it.
reviews.title: Nice stay
Cheap and Cozy
reviews.text: My room was on the smaller side, but very manageable. The room had two queen beds, a nightstand, a writing desk, a chest of drawers, and a wing chair by the window for reading. One mattress was very soft, one was of medium firmness. The one closet was amply sized with a good amount of hangers. There were an iron and ironing board in the closet as well. Several books/publications concerning the San Francisco area had been thoughtfully laid out on the desk. There was a bolt lock on the room door. There was a television with a handful of free cable channels available (no movie rentals, etc.) and an alarm clock/radio.

reviews.title: Spunky Staff--Sketchy Neighborhood
reviews.text: The bathroom was small but functional, with the tiled shower (no tub), toilet, and sink each in their own niche (think cruise ship). There was an abundance of clean, fluffy white towels and face cloths. A hairdryer was located next to the sink. Water pressure was excellent - the hot water came up piping hot very quickly and the cold water was actually cold. The room was very quiet except for the usual water nosies one hears in every hotel. An ice bucket was provided, however there is not an ice machine located on each floor.

One call out is that there is no air conditioning (there is central heating for the cooler times of the year) which is typical of older/smaller hotels in this area. Once the outside temperature climbs past 80 the room will start becoming uncomfortable during the day. During the evening the temperature typically dropped 10-15 degrees. Ventilation is limited to a fairly large sliding portion of the street window and a half window which can be opened in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!
Wonderful spot for great price
reviews.text: An eight-night stay here was completely wonderful. Staff was truly helpful and went above and beyond at every opportunity. The room was very quiet and clean (maybe the walls could have used another coat of paint, though) and comfortable. Bathroom had hot water, good soaps, etc. The tv had pretty hideous reception, but we were not there to watch it! The location was super--about 1.5 blocks from a BART station and 2 blocks from a major uptown bus line. The neighborhood immediately to the west was not ideal, with many homeless. However, this seems to be the case at the finest hotels in this town. Overall, I highly recommend it and hope to return myself.

reviews.title: clean, character, & charm at great price
reviews.text: Loved it and would stay there again. Before booking I had read some reviews that commented on the sketchy location. I'm glad we chose Bijout anyway; here's what we found: The hotel is on the corner, and the front entrance (and parking) is on a relatively quiet street. To the west is the Tenderloin neighborhood, which can be intimidating to those not comfortable with gritty downtown areas. HOWEVER, immediately east and north are more bustling, visitor-oriented, commercial, and theater areas -- which feel busy and safe. Police patrols seemed common, too. The location shouldn't scare you unless you are the very most faint-of-heart who really feels more comfortable in mega-hotels and mall settings. The location also makes a car obsolete!

reviews.title: Really different
reviews.text: I loved the character of the hotel, the look of the rooms (decor and archtecture and brand-new feel), the cinematic theme (a screening room in the lobby! c'mon, how can you beat that?!), the boutiquey feel, and the professional staff. We had no problems with nighttime street noise or lights. (We were on an upper floor, and had requested [and got] a room off the main street.)

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: My one could-be-better comment is: the lighting in the breakfast room feels institutional (hospital?) and the food fare is processed white-flour bagels/muffins. The teas and coffe are good.

reviews.title: Great Idea, Somebody
reviews.text: I spent one night here, and a friend I was travelling with stayed for a week. The staff were friendly, and really helpful, they made the trip for us. The rooms were really nice and comfy, and spotless. Breakfast was ok, bagles and muffins, nothing fancy. teh Mini cinema with the free popcorn was a definte plus, as was the area (5 minutes from union square, f line, bart and cable cars). I would definitely go back when I'm next in the city

description: Hotel Bijou is the most unique of all the Bay Area boutique hotels in downtown San Francisco. Inspired by San Francisco’s rich cinematic history, our San Francisco Union Square hotel is adorned with classic movie palace designs and dramatic Hollywood portraits. We even have a mini movie theater in our lobby showing a nightly double feature of glamorous San Francisco-based movies.Each of our 65 comfortable guest rooms in our Union Square hotel in San Francisco is named after a motion picture shot here in the city. Using the original movie stills as decorative accents, Hotel Bijou provides our guests with the most interesting downtown San Francisco hotel rooms while simultaneously keeping you centrally located to everything this exciting city has to offer.
